job_details.Vacaturetitel: Full Stack Software Developer | Accounts & Team Experience
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
* Design, implement and maintain new features for the DeepL Business Technology space, collaborating with multiple engineering teams

     * Develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services as per our technical agreements with customers and requirements from the product management team

     * Contribute to monitoring the services in production, e.g. by defining expressive metrics and ensuring informative logs

   What we offer
     * Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

     * Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.
job_details.full_text:
Full Stack Software Developer | Accounts & Team Experience

* Design, implement and maintain new features for the DeepL Business Technology space, collaborating with multiple engineering teams

     * Develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services as per our technical agreements with customers and requirements from the product management team

     * Contribute to monitoring the services in production, e.g. by defining expressive metrics and ensuring informative logs

   What we offer
     * Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

     * Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on traditional full-stack software development, feature implementation, and maintaining enterprise-level services. While it mentions 'DeepL Business Technology space' and 'enablement services', there is no explicit mention of AI, machine learning, generative models, or related technologies. The responsibilities described align more with general software engineering rather than specialized AI roles like ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer. The emphasis on collaboration, communication, and remote work are soft skills and company culture aspects, not core technical AI responsibilities. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it is not a technical AI role.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Design, implement and maintain new features' and 'Develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services' directly relates to building and maintaining software applications and services.
job_tasks.phrase: Design, implement and maintain new features

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services' indicates the creation and upkeep of software services for business use.
job_tasks.phrase: Develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Contribute to monitoring the services in production, e.g. by defining expressive metrics and ensuring informative logs' describes the operational aspects of managing software in a live environment, which is a component of MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to monitoring the services in production, e.g. by defining expressive metrics and ensuring informative logs

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'as per our technical agreements with customers and requirements from the product management team' shows an understanding of external and internal requirements that guide development.
job_tasks.phrase: as per our technical agreements with customers and requirements from the product management team

soft_skills.phrase: leading with empathy makes us better together
we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity
